[/INST]Dividends are payments made by companies to their shareholders from profits. In Australia, dividends can be 'franked' or 'unfranked.' Franked dividends come with a franking credit, representing the tax the company has already paid on its profits. You can use this credit to offset your own tax liability.</s>
